intro: Lithocarpus melataiensis, commonly known as the dark-leaved stone oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are typically dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. Its fruit is a hard, woody nut enclosed in a cupule, a feature common among members of the genus Lithocarpus. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
